climbs.name: West face AKA Sierra Club Route.

content.description: One of the better beginner climbs at Melrose. Climb the vertical jug haul making up the west face.
content.location: Located on west side of JT boulder. Just left of SW Dihedral.

content.description: JT Arête climbs the left side of the Stone Masters Arête.
content.location: Located on the left hand side of arête, that makes up southeast side of boulder.

content.description: Classic arête climb. Sit or Stand start, the crux comes high while cranking off thin crimps to throw for the barn door, arête, top out mantle.
content.location: The Stone Masters Arête, climbs the right Side of the obvious arête that makes up the southeast side of the JT Boulder.

content.description: Climbs the obvious and clean right facing dihedral. Good holds at top of corner.
content.location: The obvious geometric right facing corner on the south side of boulder. Just left of JT's Arête.

content.description: This Mantle test piece mantles into the shallow chest high scoop, via thin nubbin crimps, tricky foot work and creative body leveraging. Now top out!
content.location: PWMB climbs the obvious shallow scooped feature. Located on the far left side, of the east face of boulder. Just right of Stone Masters Arête.

content.description: Another exciting traverse on great features. The Crux comes at the end, when you have to decide how far you want to go before you have to crank the top out, on one of the above climbs!
content.location:
The Golden Age Traverse starts off of the lowest part of the descent slab. Climbing left to right, stay low on fun jug features until it becomes possible to top out any of the climbs on the Jim Thoen Boulder.

Easiest variation is to traverse and finish as of Sierra Club Route. Most difficult variation finishes via Stone Master Arête.

climbs.name: Dime Edge Crimping Masters AKA The Thin White Line.

content.description: Old school tech slab. It's all about cranking onto the chest high horizontal crimp/rail.
content.location: Located on east face of JT Boulder. Follows obvious thin white crystal vein. Just right of PWMB.
